author: Selman Demirdoven, Full Stack Web Developer, https://github.com/demirdoven, sdemirdoven35@gmail.com, selman@thethaiger.com
title: Thailand's 30 baht healthcare policy gets public approval | Thaiger
text: Thailand’s 30 Baht Treatment Anywhere policy has received widespread approval from the public, providing accessible health services for minor illnesses through community pharmacies in 45 provinces.The 30 Baht Treatment Anywhere policy , which allows citizens to receive healthcare services for minor ailments at designated quality pharmacies, has been warmly received by the public. This initiative, part of the National Health Security Office (NHSO) and the Pharmacy Council’s ongoing efforts, aims to extend healthcare access to individuals under the national health insurance scheme, commonly known as the 30 Baht Gold Card.Deputy spokesperson for the Prime Minister ’s Office Karom Pholpruek revealed the policy’s success today. The initiative, which covers 16 common illnesses, has notably improved healthcare access for minor ailments in 45 provinces.Data from the Advanced Medical Electronic Data (AMED) system, managed by the National Science and Technology Development Agency (NSTDA), indicated significant usage of the service. As of July 8, 2,151 community pharmacies are participating in the programme, providing services to 1,125,253 individuals.These individuals have accessed services a total of 2,849,528 times. The largest user group, people aged 45 to 64, accounted for 429,907 service visits.The most frequent reasons for seeking care included fever, cough, and sore throat, representing 47% of all service visits, equating to 1,191,643 cases. Other common ailments included joint pain and muscle soreness with 597,737 visits, skin conditions with 339,846 visits, abdominal pain with 239,967 visits, eye-related issues with 145,591 visits, headaches with 117,091 visits, and wounds with 114,809 visits, said Karom.“The data clearly shows that the 30 Baht Treatment Anywhere policy significantly aids individuals with minor illnesses. By using the 30 Baht Gold Card, patients can receive care without incurring additional costs. The community pharmacies play a crucial role in this policy, ensuring quality and standardised care provided by professional pharmacists, who offer consultations and medication guidance.”To utilise these services without any charges, citizens can either call the NHSO hotline at 1330 for assistance in locating a nearby participating pharmacy or check the list of participating pharmacies on the NHSO website . Additionally, pharmacies part of this initiative display a sticker reading My Quality Pharmacy – Providing Minor Illness Care at their premises, reported KhaoSod.“We encourage the public to look for the My Quality Pharmacy sticker and take advantage of the services provided. This initiative is a testament to our commitment to improving healthcare accessibility and quality for everyone.”

author: VNExplorer
title: PBS' National Memorial Day Concert To Feature World War II Tribute And Gold Star Families Remembrance
text: Joe Mantegna and Gary Sinise will return to host PBS’ National Memorial Day Concert, to take place from the west lawn of the Capitol on May 26. The event, marking its 35th anniversary, honors members of the military and their families, with an evening of music and storytelling. Among the segments planned are a tribute to World War II, featuring Bryan Cranston and spotlighting U.S. Army veteran John T. “Jack” Moran, who fought in the Battle of the Bulge. The segment also will mark the 80th anniversary of D-Day. A remembrance of Gold Star families, featuring BD Wong, will spotlight the story of Vietnam veteran and Gold Star father Allen Hoe, who followed generations of his family into service. Two of his sons also served in the U.S. Army. One of his sons, First Lieutenant Nainoa K. Hoe, was killed in combat in Operation Iraqi Freedom. Another segment, featuring Jena Malone, will focus on the challenges of veterans of Iraq and Afghanistan, with the story of U.S. Marine Corps veteran and amputee Kirstie Ennis, who sent on to become an adaptive athlete and has made it a mission to bring awareness to encourage others to reach out for help. Also featured in the concert will be Cynthia Erivo, Gary LeVox, Jamey Johnson, Mary McCormack, Ruthie Ann Miles, Patina Miller and the National Symphony Orchestra under the direction of Jack Everly. The event also will include a Salute to Services with the Joint Chiefs of Staff and Service Color Teams. Also participating will be members from The U.S. Army Herald Trumpets, The U.S. Army Chorus, The Soldiers’ Chorus of the U.S. Army Field Band, The U.S. Navy Band Sea Chanters, The U.S. Air Force Singing Sergeants and the Armed Forces Color Guard provided by the Military District of Washington, D.C. The concert will air on PBS from 8 p.m. to 9:30 p.m. ET, as well as to troops around the world on the American Forces Network. It also will stream at www.pbs.org/national-memorial-day-concert and YouTube, and will available as video on demand from May 26 to June 9. The concert is a co-production of Michael Colbert of Capital Concerts and WETA, Washington, D.C. More from Deadline

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Hawks Rookie Zaccharie Risacher: Trae Young's Bold Rookie of the Year Claim
text:
Hawks Rookie Zaccharie Risacher: Trae Young’s Bold Rookie of the Year Claim
In the competitive Rookie of the Year race,
Hawks guard Trae Young champions teammate Zaccharie Risacher as the leading candidate. The young player, drafted first overall last year, has stepped up as a starter, averaging 11.9 points, 3.7 rebounds, and 1.2 assists per game. Young believes Risacher’s performance and ability to handle pressure makes him standout among competitors. Additionally, while Magic’s Wendell Carter Jr. has faced a tough season, he showcased his skills with a crucial contribution against the Cavaliers, snapping their impressive winning streak. Meanwhile, the Hornets may be without stars LaMelo Ball and Miles Bridges more often as the season approaches its conclusion.
- Zaccharie Risacher averages 11.9 points, 3.7 rebounds, and 1.2 assists per game.
- Wendell Carter Jr. recorded 16 points and 14 rebounds in a recent game against Cleveland.
- The Hawks are aiming for a spot in the play-in tournament, bolstered by Risacher's performance.
- The Magic's recent victory over the Cavaliers ended Cleveland's 16-game winning streak.
- Charlotte's key players, LaMelo Ball and Miles Bridges, may be resting more frequently as the season ends.
Risacher's performance could solidify his position for the Rookie of the Year award if he continues to excel, while Carter's aggressive play could be vital for the Magic’s playoff ambitions. The Hornets will need to navigate player absences effectively as they look to finish the season strong.Bottom Line
Zaccharie Risacher’s development and impact on the Hawks highlight the potential future of the team alongside Trae Young, with key contributions from players like Wendell Carter Jr. proving crucial for playoff positioning. Maintaining health and performance will be vital for the Hornets as they push to end the season positively.

author: @Live5News
title: Charleston Memorial Stair Climb honors first responders who’ve lost their lives
text: Charleston Memorial Stair Climb honors first responders who lost their lives CHARLESTON, S.C. (WCSC) - Hundreds of people from all over the country participated in the 4th annual Charleston Memorial Stair Climb, which honors the first responders who have died while in the line of duty. With this week marking [17 years since the Sofa Super Store fire](https://www.live5news.com/news/charleston-9/) that killed nine Charleston firefighters, the climb honors those first responders who lost their lives here in the Lowcountry, as well as those who died on 9/11. Their goal was to have at least 412 climbers to represent the 412 first responders who lost their lives on 9/11, and they ended up having over 430. Each participant climbed 110 flights of stairs inside the North Charleston Coliseum, which is the number of flights that were climbed in the Twin Towers on Sept. 11, 2001. Many people from the Lowcountry climbed the stairs on Saturday, as well as some from Seattle, Louisiana, Florida and New York. Charleston Memorial Stair Climb Event Director Rachel Cole says that the Mount Pleasant Fire Department won the largest department award this year. She says this year has been the largest crowd they have seen in the four years of putting on this event. “The Charleston Memorial Stair Climb is designed to help all of us remember the day of 9/11, to help us honor those that we lost that day, the first responders that died in the line of duty, and to take some time to show that we truly will never forget,” Cole says. She says another thing they try to point out is the mental health issues seen in first responders today. “Part of our emphasis for the climb is making sure that we bring awareness to mental health issues. So, there are so many firefighters that are still on the job after going through something like 9/11 or the tragedy we had here in Charleston with the Charleston Nine, so one of the important things for us is to make sure that they know there are resources out there, there is help out there for them, and they are not alone,” Cole says. Hannah Wolf drove from Savannah, Georgia to make the climb. She says she wanted to be able to show her support to not only first responders in the area but also at a larger level. “It’s important to honor and remember those that have passed, but it’s also, they mentioned in the opening remarks, you know, that people are still suffering from this even after the event of 9/11,” Wolf says. “They talked a lot about mental health and everything and that is a huge, huge reason to show up and support the community. They do so much for us, and we should do the same for them.” Colin Cotter and Reilly Kilbride also participated in the climb and are with Lexington County Fire Services in South Carolina. They say they believe it is important to put in the sweat and steps to show that you honor those who have lost their lives. “It’s easy to say that you want to honor your brothers, but you got to put the work in behind it, you know, I mean those of us that have lost friends like they are looking down at you and they want you to do the work too,” Cotter says. “So, this is my second year actually doing the stair climb, my wife is over there she did it with me, and next year my son is going to do it with me. So, this is a tradition I want to have in my family to just raise and ride and honor the people that have, you know, passed before us,” Kilbride says. The funds raised from the climb go towards supporting first responder organizations. Their largest donation goes towards the Lowcountry Firefighter Support Team. They also donate funds to other organizations such as Texas Brotherhood Ride, One Soldier One Dog One Mission, MUSC Children’s Health and S.C. Firefighters’ Burned Children’s Fund, and the Police Unity Tour. The Charleston Memorial Stair Climb has been able to donate over $40,000 from its past three events. Cole says she hopes that the event continues to grow so that they can continue to pass on to future generations what it means to never forget. The climb is a sanctioned event under the Association of Memorial Stair Climbs. Copyright 2024 WCSC. All rights reserved.

author: Ambitocom
title: Inesperado cambio del clima en el AMBA: vuelven las lluvias y habrá días de altas temperaturas
text:
El temporal que causó inundaciones y destrozos en el Área Metropolitana de Buenos Aires (AMBA) se detuvo el jueves. Con un gran descenso de la temperatura, se vivió una jornada sin probabilidad de lluvias y le dio la oportunidad a las personas de recuperarse tras los daños causados en sus hogares.
 Ahora, se dio un inesperado cambio del clima en la Ciudad de Buenos Aires y alrededores ya que el Servicio Meteorológico Nacional (SMN) anunció nuevas lluvias y pronosticó altas temperaturas en pleno otoño para la semana próxima.
Informate más Alarma: crece nivel del mar por efecto de La Niña y el cambio climático Alerta meteorológico por tormentas fuertes en 7 provincias: las zonas afectadas Calor y lluvia en el AMBA: para cuándo está pronosticado clima-buenos-aires-lluvia.jpg Anuncian lluvias y calor en el AMBA.
Depositphotos Según el organismo meteorológico, el miércoles 27 de marzo pueden volver las lluvias al AMBA . Las precipitaciones tendrían lugar por la tarde-noche y se extenderían hasta la madrugada del jueves 28.
Por otra parte, el SMN prevé que desde este domingo 24 de marzo se experimentará un gran aumento en las temperaturas , con mínimas de 20° y máximas que alcanzarán los 30° . Por ahora, el pronóstico indica que el calor se mantendría durante el fin de semana de Semana Santa , el cual comienza el jueves 28 de marzo.
Clima en CABA: qué se espera para el fin de semana Durante este viernes 22 de marzo, el clima en la Ciudad de Buenos Aires y alrededores se presentará con cielos despejados y no hay probabilidad de precipitaciones. Se prevé una temperatura con una mínima de 10° y una máxima de 23°.
Para el sábado se espera buen tiempo, con el cielo despejado y sin probabilidad de lluvia. Sobre la temperatura, estiman una mínima de 16° y una máxima que alcanzará los 24°. Finalmente, el domingo se espera un clima agradable, sin lluvias y con cielo despejado. La máxima podría llegar a los 27° y la mínima sería de 19°.
